nodes.bodyText: this added whitespace should be removed
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -116,7 +116,7 @@ threadpool.size.description=The size of the thread pool.
 servlet.request.total.description=The number of visits to this servlet since the start of the server.
 servlet.responseTime.total.description=The total response time of this servlet since the start of the server.
 
-connectionpool.create.total.description=The total number of managed connections that have been created since the pool creation.

@@ -0,0 +1,58 @@
+#*******************************************************************************
+# Copyright (c) 2020 IBM Corporation and others.
+# All rights reserved. This program and the accompanying materials
+# are made available under the terms of the Eclipse Public License v1.0
+# which accompanies this distribution, and is available at
+# http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-v10.html
+#
+# Contributors:
+#     IBM Corporation - initial API and implementation
+#*******************************************************************************
+-include= ~../cnf/resources/bnd/bundle.props
+bVersion=1.0
+
+Bundle-Name: gRPC Monitor
+Bundle-SymbolicName: io.openliberty.grpc.1.0.internal.monitor
+Bundle-Description: gRPC Monitor, version ${bVersion}
+
+# Using version=! in order to not have a version attached to the import for packages that were removed
+# from Java after Java 8.  Doing this keeps the import like before Java 11 support. It will get the 
+# packages from Java when using Java 8 or earlier and from the new shipped bundles for Java 9 and later.
+Import-Package: \
+  !*.internal.*,*
+	
+Export-Package: \
+  io.openliberty.grpc; type="ibm-api", \

nodes.bodyText: should these descriptions be NLS translated?
I don't think so. I don't see other strings in NLS files.
should these descriptions be NLS translated?
I don't think so. I don't see other strings in NLS files.
can you give this test a more specific name?  having duplicate test names could cause confusion in the final junit report
Please set this to noship or beta and edition to full
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,14 @@
+-include= ~${workspace}/cnf/resources/bnd/feature.props
+symbolicName=io.openliberty.grpcMonitor-1.0
+Manifest-Version: 1.0
+IBM-API-Package: io.openliberty.grpc.monitor; type="ibm-api"
+IBM-Provision-Capability: \
+  osgi.identity; filter:="(&(type=osgi.subsystem.feature)(osgi.identity=com.ibm.websphere.appserver.monitor-1.0))", \
+  osgi.identity; filter:="(&(type=osgi.subsystem.feature)(|(osgi.identity=io.openliberty.grpc-1.0)(osgi.identity=io.openliberty.grpcClient-1.0)))"
+IBM-Install-Policy: when-satisfied
+-bundles=io.openliberty.grpc.1.0.internal.monitor, \
+  io.openliberty.grpc.1.0.internal, \
+  io.openliberty.grpc.1.0.internal.client
+kind=ga

nodes.bodyText: I'm not sure you want to pull these two bundles into both this feature and the auto feature above?? Makes the auto feature a little redundant?
Same here ... my guess is that io.openliberty.grpc.1.0.internal.monitor should only be pulled in by the auto feature.
I am guessing that this auto feature should only pull in io.openliberty.grpc.1.0.internal.monitor?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,14 @@
+-include= ~${workspace}/cnf/resources/bnd/feature.props
+symbolicName=io.openliberty.grpcMonitor-1.0
+Manifest-Version: 1.0
+IBM-API-Package: io.openliberty.grpc.monitor; type="ibm-api"
+IBM-Provision-Capability: \
+  osgi.identity; filter:="(&(type=osgi.subsystem.feature)(osgi.identity=com.ibm.websphere.appserver.monitor-1.0))", \
+  osgi.identity; filter:="(&(type=osgi.subsystem.feature)(|(osgi.identity=io.openliberty.grpc-1.0)(osgi.identity=io.openliberty.grpcClient-1.0)))"
+IBM-Install-Policy: when-satisfied
+-bundles=io.openliberty.grpc.1.0.internal.monitor, \
+  io.openliberty.grpc.1.0.internal, \
+  io.openliberty.grpc.1.0.internal.client
